review_title: Full of incompetent people, only hire/promote friends
pros: Everyone seems friendly. Looks good on your resume because people from the outside think Baptist is the best
cons: Maybe they once did care about their employees and their patients well being but are now only concerned about profits. They are "non-profit" but Baptist Health Enterprise isn't. Promotions are very slow, if any at all. And good luck being hired unless you are related to management. They obviously do not care how much education job applicants have as half of the nurses at Baptist can barely speak english. Show up to an interview with a 2 Masters Degrees but no employee referal and if your lucky theyll start you above minimum wage. "The best place to be your best"? If they are paying me half of what I could be making at other companies with the same job role then it hardly lives up to that.

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Coworkers for the most part are pretty good.
cons: Management is terrible!  Dishonest, stealing overtime from everyone, constantly short-staffing various departments, causes delays and issues with patients waiting for care, etc.  Most important thing to management is the bottom line...how many employees can I screw over to make my bonus check bigger!  The patient is NOT the most important thing to Baptist Medical Center.  It's MONEY!!!!  Their medical insurance for their employees is outrageous, doesn't even cover an employee's husband who has cancer.  The lousy insurance carrier that Baptist Medical Center has for it's employees families will NOT cover her husband's cancer treatment!!  No joke!  Horrible employer!!!!!!  Extremely dishonest, not Baptist or Christian or anything close to it!!  Lowest paying hospital in town!!!  Seriously!  No opportunity for advancement or reward for your HARD WORK!  None!!!!  The most important thing to Baptist is their precious phony public image and MONEY!!!!  They wil do ANYTHING to their employees, including stealing overtime and lunch breaks from them, on a routine basis, in order to make the department heads big fat bonuses even BIGGER!!  They don't care!!!  Don't let their "not for profit" BS fool you!  It's all about the money and image!  Screw the employees, and they PRETEND to care about their patients, but that means nothing to the management at this hospital!!  Nothing!!

pros: Good culture and enjoy co-workers
cons: Lack of resources & too many projects

pros: Collaboration, supportive, opportunities for advancement
cons: Need to ensure leadership is aware of your worth

pros: Flexible hours for PRN positions
cons: Had to float around a lot as a PRN

pros: Team culture. Great peds specialties
cons: Expensive health insurance, staffing issues

pros: Your paycheck will always clear for whichever crazy schedule they have your working. Some good employee events, and decent insurance benefits if you are seen at a baptist facility. You can do just about anything wrong in your job after the first 90 days and still have a job!
cons: All employees are not created equal or held to the same standards. You may earn PTO hours every pay period but do not plan on using them, because they may be approved by some doesn't actually mean payroll will pay you.  If you work on-call don't count on getting paid because payroll will repeatedly mess up on  on call time and fail to include it in necessary pay check. All employees in the same position will not be expected to preform the same job, some are just told to do the best they can. I was warned by the individual I was replacing of  the inconsistent,  micromanaging  and I saw this first hand. This is definitely NOT  a company that you can expect your boss to do the same job they are asking you to do.  Compared to other similar facilities in the area your pay is low for the expected job.  From the maintenance side this facility was built and maintained  inadequately

pros: I was with Baptist Health in Jacksonville Florida since 2005 as an RN and went back to school for ARNP 2010-2012. No positions available for me when I graduated so I had to leave but returned when a position opened up less than a year later (but lost my vested seniority). The health system has Magnet designation where furthering education is very important second only to providing excellent evidenced based care to the patients. However, compared to other hospitals in the area, the pay is less. It is an "unspoken benefit" that being employed there makes up for the difference in pay. Although, working conditions are better compared to other hospitals in the area.
cons:
--I don't feel Baptist utilizes ARNPs to their highest ability. The education, care and time we spend with patients (time the physicians may not have) is invaluable and patients come to rely on us to explain or teach them.
--Communication between middle management and staff is lacking severely.

review_title: Not bad but not the best
job_title: Patient Care Representative in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Great work environment. Education paid for up to $2000 yearly for FT employee. Benefits are above average (but not the best.)
cons: Very low pay in comparison to other facilities. Over worked and understaffed often. Not much room for growth if not RN. Can be cliches at times. Management can be quick to punish without getting both sides. Need more training by people who know how to train. Unprofessional in the way Director comments about people's work in front of peers and even disciplines in front of peers, which is unprofessional and demeaning.

review_title: Management is a major problem, the pay is really low.
job_title: Information Technology Tech in Jacksonville, FL
pros: My co-workers are mostly nice. Baptist supports volunteers and volunteer programs.
cons: The overall culture of Baptist has changed over the last few years. Management is quick to protect themselves and their friends while making everyone else take the fall. Everyone I know here is saying that they are not getting a raise this year despite work performance. Everyone is stressed, pointing fingers, unhappy, and overworked. Many of us are forced to work 60 plus hours a week with no overtime pay. I have missed every family birthday, anniversary, and event this year because I was told I had to work. They don't care about work life balance.  Upper management told us that they aren't doing their job right if they don't get rid of most of the staff to hire in "fresh blood".

pros: Good benefits package, Payroll deduction for food/gift shop for FT employees, Equipment is up-to-date (computers etc), Best Health System in Jacksonville, FL
cons: Light years behind other hospitals as far as the internal programs we use , PTO accrual for sick, vacation, etc is mediocre  (not the worst i've seen but not the best) After being 5 yrs employed  you get around 7hrs PTO per pay period, No room to move up within company, Raises are said to be based on production but you only get "cost of living" adjustment each year.

review_title: “Leaders who don't listen will eventually be surrounded by people who have nothing to say.”
job_title: Prefer Not to Answer in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Fine place to work if you are either a "player" or manage to maintain a low enough profile not to be noticed.
cons: Too many posing to be leaders with little regard for the impact they bring about.  Secure in their roles as they seem to be immune from any real scrutiny.  My time there was brief, but from what I learned from others it has been this way for a long time... i.e. indicators are high turnover rate and low, very low, employee engagement survey results, with no acknowledgement from leadership of what the real problems are.... very poor, one way communications.  Responsibility is then deferred to the lowest level.  Less than hospital environment.

review_title: Not Sure Magnet Status is a Good Thing...
job_title: Staff RN in Jacksonville Beach, FL
pros: Lots of different patients in ICU. Nicely laid out ICU. Clean.
cons: Low pay. Nit picking. They cannot keep staff. Many nurses in ICU not happy. Mandatory is their favorite word. Cannot get time off. Always feel management was trying to intimidate staff. Hourly rounding in the ICU, really? Observed Nepotism with promotion of charge  nurses.  Never felt I was treated as a professional nurse. Coworkers always complaining about lack of assistance from certain charge nurses and ACPs.

pros: I am a compassionate nurse who loves my job. I love giving care to patients and helping them feel like taking care of them was my job and they feel like they received the best care. I have been in women's health for note than 18 years. I have been doing labor and Delivery for about 6 years and then the other 15 years I did mother/baby and did for about 2 years I did some high risk OB. I am now doing mother and baby and training in Labor again.
cons: I working in hospital as staff nurse and love doing bed side care, but some days when you are so busy and don't have enough help it is frustrating not able to give good care.

review_title: Market leader in healthcare in North Florida.
pros:
Great company. They take good care of their people. Our business is healthcare, so employees can expect to receive the best in that field. But the remainder of the benefits package is comprehensive, as well. Leadership works hard to stay ahead of the curve in a rapidly evolving market. And I think they are doing that job well. 

Good work environment. Naturally that will vary by unit. However, I perceive that leadership wants to help people find the role that suits them and then succeed at it.
cons: Healthcare is a high stress industry. It can't be anything other than a pressure cooker at times. That's true for any company in the industry, I'm sure.

job_title: Executive Assistant in Ponte Vedra Beach, FL
pros: Excellent benefits and an amazing culture of values and promotion of excellence in standard of care. There is an attitude of positivity for changing lives and making a difference in the lives of the patients and their families. It is a place where you can be proud to say you work!
cons: Lowest paying hospital in area. Poor annual increases comparatively.

pros: You earn a paycheck every two weeks.
cons:
High turnover in all departments and job groups.
Terrible PTO policy - vacation, sick and holiday coverage (if your department is closed) all come from the same allotment.  6.77 hours earned per 80 hours worked every two weeks.
Pay is low in comparison to other institutions.
Parking is always an issue, including at the designated employee lots which are blocks away from the hospital.
Attitudes from Senior leadership are borderline hostile.
All are expected to provide support during emergency situations (ex: hurricane), including non-medical staff, which is not disclosed until you have been hired.

pros: Benefits are excellent/Human Resources very pleasant, appearing understanding when issues arose. Clean atmosphere. Confidentiality for patients and staff as relates to Human Resource Department and actual claim submission beyond reproach.
cons: Cliquish/hard to communicate with co-workers/cold atmosphere in billing office/Jealousy, strife and backbiting abounds. Upper management on sight totally unaware. Interpersonal issues were common place. Yet manageable if you listen and avoid pitfalls.

pros: You get hospital experience. I don't have any more anything to say about this hospital which is in downtown Jax.
cons: Long drawn out hiring process. Not enough staff for floors. Over worked Nurses and Acp's. You have to stay in an area for 1 year before you can transfer to any other department.

job_title: Office Specialist I in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Good benefits, flexible hours, mostly friendly coworkers. They pay for schooling and give credits for staying healthy.  Lots of employee perks (free game tickets, discounts etc)
cons: Management seems to have a problem with letting employees be their best just so they don't outshine them, even though it's their decision to not go above and beyond for the patient. Management needs more training.

pros: Large Company with opportunity for transfer or promotion. Job security. Baptist also has a program for employee hardship that I saw help a few employees which was nice.
cons: Low pay compared to offices under other umbrella hospitals such as UF, Mayo, or MMC. Lazy, incompetent employees are tolerated and allowed to continue which causes stress for hardworking employees.

pros: Lots of opportunity to move around within the system.  New grad program. Decent benefits.  Several locations to choose from.
cons: Pay is fair.  Seems to be a lot of turnover.  They say the right things but don't always set up managers and workers for success.  Shortage of staffing.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: Great team work from staff. Great physicians! Nice to work with!
cons: Poor management on floors and throughout hospital! No open mindedness to makes changes for the better, lots of talk but no implementing! Work way too hard for poor pay for years of experience!

job_title: Financial Analyst II in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Baptist is a good and reputable hospital health system
cons: The person I reported to lacked in communication and was not well respected by his employees.  I discovered two of my fellow co-workers discovered my salary and the management knew about it and nothing was done to them.

review_title: I enjoyed this part of my life with Baptist but left sadly seeing the culture was changing.
pros: Making a difference in the lives of those in need. Working relationships within peer groups.
cons: Finger pointing from middle mgt not wanting yo take ownership and hold accountability. Therefore a lot of finger pointing. Have to learn how yo CYA! Too quick judge and to perceive inaccurate information without asking more questions or explanations.

review_title: Office Coordinator Private Practice Family Medicine
job_title: Office Coordinator in Gulf Breeze, FL
pros: Benefits are really great, they even call it your "hidden paycheck". Salaries are a little lower than average but the "hidden paycheck" well makes up for it. They also have programs that will help you go to College.
cons: As long as you are timely (which everyone should be!) it's really a great corporation to work for.

review_title: Changing healthcare for good - just not for your staff!
job_title: Staff RN in Jacksonville Beach, FL
pros: Coworkers are the best!  Great CNA team.
cons: Upper management, especially at the smaller satellite hospitals

review_title: Not great a great place to work, but not bad either
pros:
Safe patient ratio in most cases. Also best patient ratio in town
No force or coercion used when staff is short
cons:
Favoritism/Cronyism/"Cliques" permeate the company
"Customer Service" approach to care
M.D.s revered to deity like status 
Very political environment 
Lowest starting pay for registered nurses in Jacksonville area

review_title: I found my home - when I came here to work 10 years ago.
pros: Leadership really cares  about patients AND their employees.  They really are all about doing the right thing.  They are a union free workplace - they must be doing something right.
cons: Seriously - I can not think of one thing - ok... I heard parking can sometimes be a problem.  But even that has gotten better in the last couple of years.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Night shift great team nurses do help.   more pay on weekends. Love it. tuition reimbursement.
cons:
Not good at accommodating for school.
Pay is 👌. No vacation or sick time just pto and not much biweekly. Benefits are expensive.

job_title: Registered Nurse, RN in Jacksonville, FL
pros: The company overall is a great place to work.
cons: The management team.  If it was not for the management the place would be a wonderful place to work...

pros: Most hospitals in Jacksonville are he same this is a very fair place to work. I see my self working here until I change careers
cons: In realistic ideas of patient satisfaction..like all other hospitals. They want you to bend over backwards for Hcap scores. That is part of the job

review_title: A great place to work for nurses.
job_title: Registered Nurse in Fernandina Beach, FL
pros: I work at the smallest of the five hospitals in the system and have the benefit of a very personal relationship with other staff due to the size with all of the extras that come with being part of a large system.
cons: Some of the physicians are a little "outside of the guidelines" when it comes patient care and not always in a good way.

review_title: Social worker. The job started off great but kept changing
job_title: Medical Social Worker in Jacksonville, FL
pros: The benefits and pay are pretty decent. The people I work with are friendly
cons: There is absolutely no respect for this profession from leadership and there is no one in leadership that  truly understands hospital social work

review_title: Best hospital, great patient care but unhappy employees.
pros: Baptist Health Systems is well established and has plenty of customers. The main hospital is not for profit but the company holds lots of real estate and is always planing how to expand and how to get more customers from their competitors.
cons: The company continues to grow but the employees' salaries don't.

pros: Really none. Maybe decent benefits....
cons:
but otherwise, don't bother. They don't care about associates. The on call is out of control. Mgmt lies about hurricane support hours. The nepotism and favoritism is sickening. Executives aren't there to be friends nor should they be. However, the say 1 thing and their actions are another.
Do your self a favor and stay away. It's a heart attack waiting to happen. The turnover rate in IT is above 20% documented. There's a reason why they can't keep people. The only people who stay are tied to the old pension plan.

job_title: Prior Authorization Coordinator in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Good benefits: very affordable health/dental insurance, good amount of PTO. I worked in a smaller outpatient office and the doctor was very nice. Being part of a big hospital system made it easy to refer patients between offices and coordinate care
cons: Raises have been very minimal, not enough training when I first started the job. Compared to other offices that I have worked in, these are very minor things in my opinion.

job_title: Radiologic Technologist in Fernandina Beach, FL
pros: Great Employees, Friendly management, easy hiring process, fair wages, availability of hours
cons: Not enough staff during peak patient periods.  Tedious electronic and paper documentation procedures that are often redundant information.

pros: Stability, hospitals will never go broke, working for Baptist gives you a sense of job security in an unstable job market.
cons: Really bad PTO, poor inter department communication, managers with very little people skills and poor understanding of technology. Very toxic working environment.

job_title: Surgical Charge Specialist in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Baptist is a good solid company to work for. Benefits are good, but thought they would be better to the employees that work for the facilities.
cons: To few employees doing to much work with to little time to get it done.

review_title: Company wasn't bad overall, but needs some work.
pros: Benefits were good and insurance was great.
cons: Little concern for lower end employees. Training was lumped with other groups of employees that had nothing to do with the job that was to be done.

pros: Flexible Schedule and very lenient and laid back organization. Their is no micro management, come in do your work and you're good.
cons: No room for growth unless you know someone who can possibly talk to the higher ups. Its difficult to transfer from current department to a new department. The pay is low but the benefits are reasonable.

review_title: Patient Access is not difficult, but experience with insurance is key

pros: Baptist offers above par benefits and the management, in my experience, works with your when unexpected situations arise.

review_title: Baptist Medical Center, Jacksonville - great place to work, just not forever.

pros: Rate in top 100 best places to work.  The people you work with are typically a great bunch of people.

pros: There is very little about Baptist south that I liked.
cons: The employees are very rude towards the lower level positions and make them do their work for them. The staff is lazy and treated me badly and humiliated me because I did not speak English very well.

pros: Baptist is a great place to work. It alows some Flexibility depending on the area. The price of benefits are reasonable.

pros: Emphasis on good patient care.

review_title: IT is a horrible place to work
